richwcollins wrote:

>
> I have a filter and processor that require access to a database.
> Rather than reconnect to the database each time a query is desired, I
> would like to use a single connection (or connection pool) that stays
> connected.  How would I go about making the connection at the
> beginning of the crawl and then storing a reference to it somewhere
> that I can access it from a custom filter and processor?

Currently no general global store that you could stuff a connection or 
pool handle into (If there was one, CrawlController would probably be 
its host).  Here's some ideas:

+ Subclass org.archive.crawler.Heritrix and add into it db connection 
setup on startup.  You'd then make the connection pool globally 
accessible by saving the handle into a static.  This would allow you to 
call HeritrixSubClass.getDbConnection() from anywhere to gain access  
(You'd have to change the heritrix launch script so it started your 
HeritrixSubClass).
+ Or would setting up the db connection in a static block that gets run 
on classloading inside in your Processor of Filter work for you or have 
either your filter or processor go to a Singleton that holds the db 
connection reference and have it initiate the connection on construction 
or the first time its accessed?
